gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/218)
text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي مَرْيَمَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ الْحَصْبَةِ فَقَالَ كَانَ أَبِي يَنْزِلُ الْأَبْطَحَ قَلِيلًا ثُمَّ يَجِي‏ءُ وَ يَدْخُلُ الْبُيُوتَ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَنْ يَنَامَ بِالْأَبْطَحِ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ أَ رَأَيْتَ إِنْ تَعَجَّلَ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ إِنْ كَانَ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْيَمَنِ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يُحَصِّبَ قَالَ لَا .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Aban, from Abu Maryam,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having been asked about Al-Hasba. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘My<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> used to encamp at Al-Abtah. Then he<sup>asws</sup> would go and enter the houses from without sleeping in Al-Abtah’. So I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘What is your<sup>asws</sup> view if someone departs during the two days, if he was from the people of Al-Yemen, would it be upon him that he (encamps) at Hasba?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No’.
en.sarwar: 1. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla’ ibn Muhammad from al-Hassan ibn Ali from Aban from abu Maryam who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was asked about al-Hasabah. He (the Imam) said, ‘My father, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, would disembark there for a short time and enter the houses without sleeping in al- Abtah.’ I then asked, ‘If one is from Yeman and he departs in the second day of departure, is it necessary for him to disembark in al-Hasabah?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘No, it is not necessary.”’
